documentation:
Amazon Data Lifecycle Manager

With Amazon Data Lifecycle Manager, you can manage the lifecycle of your Amazon Web Services resources. You create lifecycle policies, which are used to automate operations on the specified resources.

Amazon DLM supports Amazon EBS volumes and snapshots. For information about using Amazon DLM with Amazon EBS, see Automating the Amazon EBS Snapshot Lifecycle in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.

CreateLifecyclePolicy.documentation: Creates a policy to manage the lifecycle of the specified Amazon Web Services resources. You can create up to 100 lifecycle policies.
CreateLifecyclePolicy.name: CreateLifecyclePolicy

DeleteLifecyclePolicy.documentation: Deletes the specified lifecycle policy and halts the automated operations that the policy specified.
DeleteLifecyclePolicy.name: DeleteLifecyclePolicy

GetLifecyclePolicies.documentation:
Gets summary information about all or the specified data lifecycle policies.

To get complete information about a policy, use GetLifecyclePolicy.
GetLifecyclePolicies.name: GetLifecyclePolicies

GetLifecyclePolicy.documentation: Gets detailed information about the specified lifecycle policy.
GetLifecyclePolicy.name: GetLifecyclePolicy

ListTagsForResource.documentation: Lists the tags for the specified resource.
ListTagsForResource.name: ListTagsForResource

TagResource.documentation: Adds the specified tags to the specified resource.
TagResource.name: TagResource

UntagResource.documentation: Removes the specified tags from the specified resource.
UntagResource.name: UntagResource

Action.documentation: Specifies an action for an event-based policy.

CrossRegionCopy.documentation: The rule for copying shared snapshots across Regions.

Description.documentation: A description of the lifecycle policy. The characters ^[0-9A-Za-z _-]+$ are supported.

ExecutionRoleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role used to run the operations specified by the lifecycle policy.

PolicyDetails.documentation: The configuration details of the lifecycle policy.

State.documentation: The desired activation state of the lifecycle policy after creation.

Tags.documentation: The tags to apply to the lifecycle policy during creation.

CreateRule.documentation:
Specifies when to create snapshots of EBS volumes.

You must specify either a Cron expression or an interval, interval unit, and start time. You cannot specify both.

CronExpression.documentation: The schedule, as a Cron expression. The schedule interval must be between 1 hour and 1 year. For more information, see Cron expressions in the Amazon CloudWatch User Guide.

Interval.documentation: The interval between snapshots. The supported values are 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, and 24.

Location.documentation:
Specifies the destination for snapshots created by the policy. To create snapshots in the same Region as the source resource, specify CLOUD. To create snapshots on the same Outpost as the source resource, specify OUTPOST_LOCAL. If you omit this parameter, CLOUD is used by default.

If the policy targets resources in an Amazon Web Services Region, then you must create snapshots in the same Region as the source resource.

If the policy targets resources on an Outpost, then you can create snapshots on the same Outpost as the source resource, or in the Region of that Outpost.

Times.documentation:
The time, in UTC, to start the operation. The supported format is hh:mm.

The operation occurs within a one-hour window following the specified time. If you do not specify a time, Amazon DLM selects a time within the next 24 hours.

CrossRegionCopyAction.documentation: Specifies a rule for copying shared snapshots across Regions.

EncryptionConfiguration.documentation: The encryption settings for the copied snapshot.

CrossRegionCopyDeprecateRule.documentation: Specifies an AMI deprecation rule for cross-Region AMI copies created by a cross-Region copy rule.

Interval.documentation: The period after which to deprecate the cross-Region AMI copies. The period must be less than or equal to the cross-Region AMI copy retention period, and it can't be greater than 10 years. This is equivalent to 120 months, 520 weeks, or 3650 days.

IntervalUnit.documentation: The unit of time in which to measure the Interval.

CrossRegionCopyRetainRule.documentation: Specifies the retention rule for cross-Region snapshot copies.

Interval.documentation: The amount of time to retain each snapshot. The maximum is 100 years. This is equivalent to 1200 months, 5200 weeks, or 36500 days.

IntervalUnit.documentation: The unit of time for time-based retention.

CrossRegionCopyRule.documentation: Specifies a rule for cross-Region snapshot copies.

CmkArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the KMS key to use for EBS encryption. If this parameter is not specified, the default KMS key for the account is used.

CopyTags.documentation: Indicates whether to copy all user-defined tags from the source snapshot to the cross-Region snapshot copy.

DeprecateRule.documentation: The AMI deprecation rule for cross-Region AMI copies created by the rule.

Encrypted.documentation: To encrypt a copy of an unencrypted snapshot if encryption by default is not enabled, enable encryption using this parameter. Copies of encrypted snapshots are encrypted, even if this parameter is false or if encryption by default is not enabled.

RetainRule.documentation: The retention rule that indicates how long snapshot copies are to be retained in the destination Region.

Target.documentation:
The target Region or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the target Outpost for the snapshot copies.

Use this parameter instead of TargetRegion. Do not specify both.

TargetRegion.documentation:
Avoid using this parameter when creating new policies. Instead, use Target to specify a target Region or a target Outpost for snapshot copies.

For policies created before the Target parameter was introduced, this parameter indicates the target Region for snapshot copies.

DeprecateRule.documentation: Specifies an AMI deprecation rule for a schedule.

Count.documentation: If the schedule has a count-based retention rule, this parameter specifies the number of oldest AMIs to deprecate. The count must be less than or equal to the schedule's retention count, and it can't be greater than 1000.

Interval.documentation: If the schedule has an age-based retention rule, this parameter specifies the period after which to deprecate AMIs created by the schedule. The period must be less than or equal to the schedule's retention period, and it can't be greater than 10 years. This is equivalent to 120 months, 520 weeks, or 3650 days.

IntervalUnit.documentation: The unit of time in which to measure the Interval.

EncryptionConfiguration.documentation: Specifies the encryption settings for shared snapshots that are copied across Regions.

CmkArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the KMS key to use for EBS encryption. If this parameter is not specified, the default KMS key for the account is used.

Encrypted.documentation: To encrypt a copy of an unencrypted snapshot when encryption by default is not enabled, enable encryption using this parameter. Copies of encrypted snapshots are encrypted, even if this parameter is false or when encryption by default is not enabled.

EventParameters.documentation: Specifies an event that triggers an event-based policy.

DescriptionRegex.documentation:
The snapshot description that can trigger the policy. The description pattern is specified using a regular expression. The policy runs only if a snapshot with a description that matches the specified pattern is shared with your account.

For example, specifying ^.*Created for policy: policy-1234567890abcdef0.*$ configures the policy to run only if snapshots created by policy policy-1234567890abcdef0 are shared with your account.

EventType.documentation: The type of event. Currently, only snapshot sharing events are supported.

SnapshotOwner.documentation: The IDs of the Amazon Web Services accounts that can trigger policy by sharing snapshots with your account. The policy only runs if one of the specified Amazon Web Services accounts shares a snapshot with your account.

EventSource.documentation: Specifies an event that triggers an event-based policy.

Type.documentation: The source of the event. Currently only managed CloudWatch Events rules are supported.

FastRestoreRule.documentation: Specifies a rule for enabling fast snapshot restore. You can enable fast snapshot restore based on either a count or a time interval.

AvailabilityZones.documentation: The Availability Zones in which to enable fast snapshot restore.

Count.documentation: The number of snapshots to be enabled with fast snapshot restore.

Interval.documentation: The amount of time to enable fast snapshot restore. The maximum is 100 years. This is equivalent to 1200 months, 5200 weeks, or 36500 days.

IntervalUnit.documentation: The unit of time for enabling fast snapshot restore.

PolicyIds.documentation: The identifiers of the data lifecycle policies.

TagsToAdd.documentation:
The tags to add to objects created by the policy.

Tags are strings in the format key=value.

These user-defined tags are added in addition to the Amazon Web Services-added lifecycle tags.

TargetTags.documentation:
The target tag for a policy.

Tags are strings in the format key=value.

InternalServerException.documentation: The service failed in an unexpected way.

InvalidRequestException.documentation: Bad request. The request is missing required parameters or has invalid parameters.

MutuallyExclusiveParameters.documentation: The request included parameters that cannot be provided together.

RequiredParameters.documentation: The request omitted one or more required parameters.

DateCreated.documentation: The local date and time when the lifecycle policy was created.

DateModified.documentation: The local date and time when the lifecycle policy was last modified.

ExecutionRoleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role used to run the operations specified by the lifecycle policy.

PolicyArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the policy.

State.documentation: The activation state of the lifecycle policy.

PolicyType.documentation: The type of policy. EBS_SNAPSHOT_MANAGEMENT indicates that the policy manages the lifecycle of Amazon EBS snapshots. IMAGE_MANAGEMENT indicates that the policy manages the lifecycle of EBS-backed AMIs.

State.documentation: The activation state of the lifecycle policy.

LimitExceededException.documentation: The request failed because a limit was exceeded.

ResourceType.documentation: Value is the type of resource for which a limit was exceeded.

ResourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.

Parameters.documentation: Specifies optional parameters to add to a policy. The set of valid parameters depends on the combination of policy type and resource type.

ExcludeBootVolume.documentation: [EBS Snapshot Management – Instance policies only] Indicates whether to exclude the root volume from snapshots created using CreateSnapshots. The default is false.

NoReboot.documentation: Applies to AMI lifecycle policies only. Indicates whether targeted instances are rebooted when the lifecycle policy runs. true indicates that targeted instances are not rebooted when the policy runs. false indicates that target instances are rebooted when the policy runs. The default is true (instances are not rebooted).

PolicyDetails.documentation: Specifies the configuration of a lifecycle policy.

Actions.documentation:
The actions to be performed when the event-based policy is triggered. You can specify only one action per policy.

This parameter is required for event-based policies only. If you are creating a snapshot or AMI policy, omit this parameter.

EventSource.documentation:
The event that triggers the event-based policy.

This parameter is required for event-based policies only. If you are creating a snapshot or AMI policy, omit this parameter.

Parameters.documentation:
A set of optional parameters for snapshot and AMI lifecycle policies.

This parameter is required for snapshot and AMI policies only. If you are creating an event-based policy, omit this parameter.

PolicyType.documentation:
The valid target resource types and actions a policy can manage. Specify EBS_SNAPSHOT_MANAGEMENT to create a lifecycle policy that manages the lifecycle of Amazon EBS snapshots. Specify IMAGE_MANAGEMENT to create a lifecycle policy that manages the lifecycle of EBS-backed AMIs. Specify EVENT_BASED_POLICY to create an event-based policy that performs specific actions when a defined event occurs in your Amazon Web Services account.

The default is EBS_SNAPSHOT_MANAGEMENT.

ResourceLocations.documentation:
The location of the resources to backup. If the source resources are located in an Amazon Web Services Region, specify CLOUD. If the source resources are located on an Outpost in your account, specify OUTPOST.

If you specify OUTPOST, Amazon Data Lifecycle Manager backs up all resources of the specified type with matching target tags across all of the Outposts in your account.

ResourceTypes.documentation:
The target resource type for snapshot and AMI lifecycle policies. Use VOLUME to create snapshots of individual volumes or use INSTANCE to create multi-volume snapshots from the volumes for an instance.

This parameter is required for snapshot and AMI policies only. If you are creating an event-based policy, omit this parameter.

Schedules.documentation:
The schedules of policy-defined actions for snapshot and AMI lifecycle policies. A policy can have up to four schedules—one mandatory schedule and up to three optional schedules.

This parameter is required for snapshot and AMI policies only. If you are creating an event-based policy, omit this parameter.

TargetTags.documentation:
The single tag that identifies targeted resources for this policy.

This parameter is required for snapshot and AMI policies only. If you are creating an event-based policy, omit this parameter.

ResourceIds.documentation: Value is a list of resource IDs that were not found.

ResourceType.documentation: Value is the type of resource that was not found.

RetainRule.documentation: Specifies the retention rule for a lifecycle policy. You can retain snapshots based on either a count or a time interval.

Count.documentation: The number of snapshots to retain for each volume, up to a maximum of 1000.

Interval.documentation: The amount of time to retain each snapshot. The maximum is 100 years. This is equivalent to 1200 months, 5200 weeks, or 36500 days.

IntervalUnit.documentation: The unit of time for time-based retention.

Schedule.documentation: Specifies a backup schedule for a snapshot or AMI lifecycle policy.

CopyTags.documentation: Copy all user-defined tags on a source volume to snapshots of the volume created by this policy.

CrossRegionCopyRules.documentation:
The rule for cross-Region snapshot copies.

You can only specify cross-Region copy rules for policies that create snapshots in a Region. If the policy creates snapshots on an Outpost, then you cannot copy the snapshots to a Region or to an Outpost. If the policy creates snapshots in a Region, then snapshots can be copied to up to three Regions or Outposts.

DeprecateRule.documentation: The AMI deprecation rule for the schedule.

FastRestoreRule.documentation: The rule for enabling fast snapshot restore.

ShareRules.documentation: The rule for sharing snapshots with other Amazon Web Services accounts.

TagsToAdd.documentation: The tags to apply to policy-created resources. These user-defined tags are in addition to the Amazon Web Services-added lifecycle tags.

VariableTags.documentation: A collection of key/value pairs with values determined dynamically when the policy is executed. Keys may be any valid Amazon EC2 tag key. Values must be in one of the two following formats: $(instance-id) or $(timestamp). Variable tags are only valid for EBS Snapshot Management – Instance policies.

ShareRule.documentation: Specifies a rule for sharing snapshots across Amazon Web Services accounts.

TargetAccounts.documentation: The IDs of the Amazon Web Services accounts with which to share the snapshots.

UnshareInterval.documentation: The period after which snapshots that are shared with other Amazon Web Services accounts are automatically unshared.

UnshareIntervalUnit.documentation: The unit of time for the automatic unsharing interval.

ResourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.

ExecutionRoleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role used to run the operations specified by the lifecycle policy.

PolicyDetails.documentation: The configuration of the lifecycle policy. You cannot update the policy type or the resource type.

State.documentation: The desired activation state of the lifecycle policy after creation.
